instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot no green light
threads.message:
Hi, got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that does not turn on and does not have green light.

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is shorted. Removed L7095 and the short is on the system side.

Injected 3V/2A but nothing is getting warm. I am afraid of injecting more an damaging something

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot no green light
threads.message:
Are you sure you've injected 2A, or that is the limit set on lab PSU?
If there is pure short (close to 0 ohm), board wants to take more than 10A maybe.
In such case, limiting to 2A, PSU gets blocked and doesn't inject anything.
